KAK. *Karlsteen, Karl Oskar Arvid Henrik, ingenjör, stadsbyggmästare, Göteborg, f. 27/8/90 i Sthlm. G. m. Lisa Carlsson. Barn: Britta f. 23. — Lä-rovistud. i Sthlm, ex. v. STI 14. Konstr. o. ing. v. Bergsmek. byrån i Ludvika 15-17, chef f. Domnarvets Jernverks arkit:byrå 17-24, byggn:-ing. h. folksk:styr. i Gbg 24-31, stads-byggmäst. i Gbg sed. 31. Medi. av Sthlms gymnrförb. 10-15. Svgifrfb plakett, Sthlms gymn:förb. MM.
translated:
Karlsson, Karil Gustaf Yngve, parish pastor, KäUby, born on July 19, 1901, in Habo, Skaraborg. First marriage in 1935 with Emma Gurli Eleonora Rang. Children: Sigfrid, born in 1936; Ragnar, born in 1937; Birgitta, born in 1939; Harald, born in 1941; Yngve Efraimj, born in 1943. Education: graduated in Uppsala in 1926, theological studies in 1927, practical theology examination in the same year, ordained as a pastor in 1930. Pastoral appointments in KäUby from 1930-1933, in Habo from 1933-1934, diocesan adjutant from 1934-1938, church adjutant in Skövde from 1938-1941, parish pastor in Källby from 1941. Chairman of church councils and school boards, member of the board of children's welfare. 

Carlsson-Betts, Inez, practicing physician in Ronneby, born on May 3, 1891, in Karlshamn, to Carl Fredrik Carlsson and Ingrid Nilsson. Second marriage in 1942 with former engineer William Betts. Education: graduated in 1911, medical candidate in 1914, medical licentiate in 1920, all in Stockholm. Further studies in several European countries. Worked as a medical intern at various hospitals and clinics from 1916-1919, clinical assistant at Stockholm Hospital in 1917 and 1920, resident physician at Växjö Hospital in 1920, second assistant physician at Högbo Tuberculosis Hospital in 1921, acting chief physician there in 1921-1922, physician at Älvgården Hospital in Dalarna and Västmanland Tuberculosis Hospital in 1922, assistant physician and acting second assistant physician at Vänersborg Hospital in 1922-1923, physician at Pensionatstyrelsen's Hospital in Åre from 1923-1925, temporary chief physician for three months, temporary district medical officer in Ronneby with a district of fil. studies during short periods from 1925-1947, practicing physician in Ronneby since 1925, physician at the Blekinge Municipal Care Home since 1929. Member of the City Council from 1930-1942. 

Carlsson Ring, Carl Johan, director, lay judge, Ringås, born on August 26, 1899, in Örtomta, Östergötland county, son of lay judge C. J. Carlsson and Maria Larsdotter. Married in 1927 to Aina Görarns son. Children: Björn, born in 1928; Birgitta, born in 1931. Education: graduated in Linköping in 1919. Employed at Stockholm Footwear Factory A-B from 1919-1924, entered his father's firm Carlsson Ring in Örtomta in 1924, director of Aukt. firm C. J. Carlsson Ring in Linköping since 1928. Lay judge in Linköping Court since 1934, held several positions in economic associations and municipal tasks. Member of the Odd Fellow and KAK (Swedish Automobile Club). 

Karlsteen, Karl Oskar Arvid Henrik, engineer, city architect, Gothenburg, born on August 27, 1890, in Stockholm. Married to Lisa Carlsson. Child: Britta, born in 1923. Education: studied at a high school in Stockholm, graduated from STI in 1914. Construction and engineering work at Bergsmek. Agency in Ludvika from 1915-1917, head of Domnarvet Ironworks' architectural bureau from 1917-1924, building engineer for the public elementary school board in Gothenburg from 1924-1931, city architect in Gothenburg since 1931. Member of Stockholm Gymnastics Association from 1910-1915. Recipient of the Sthlms Gymnastic Association plaque.
